paper_abstract: We consider the problem of triangulating an x-monotone polygon with a small number of different edge lengths using Steiner points. Given a parameter alpha, where 0 < alpha < 1, we shall present an algorithm for finding an almost uniform triangular mesh with 3 pi/8 alpha(2) + o(1/alpha(2)) different edge lengths such that every edge length is between l and (2 + root 2 alpha)l. Experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of this algorithm.
paper_title: Finding a triangular mesh with a constant number of different edge lengths
